comments:
3.1 M2

While working on the tutorial mentioned in bug 75207, I needed to export a
package from the bundle for example 2, and import it from the bundle for example
2b.  

There seemed to be tool support in the Runtime tab in the manifest editor to do
this, but both radio buttons were disabled.  The Add button was not disabled,
however, so I used that to add the package for export.
It added the following line to the MANIFEST.MF:
Provide-Package: tutorial.example2.service

There did not seem to be any tool support for defining imports, so I added the
following line manually to the MANIFEST.MF for example 2b.
Import-Package: tutorial.example2.service

If I run with this, it fails with:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Sep 28, 2004 16:12:23.518
!MESSAGE Startup error
!STACK 1
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Bundle
initial@reference:file:d:/eclipse-new/plugins/GravityServiceBinder2b/ was not
resolved.
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.startBundles(EclipseStarter.java:824)
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.loadBasicBundles(EclipseStarter.java:439)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.startup(EclipseStarter.java:222)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:127)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:85)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:185)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:704)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:688)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Sep 28, 2004 16:12:23.538
!MESSAGE Bundle
initial@reference:file:d:/eclipse-new/plugins/GravityServiceBinder2b/ [2] was
not resolved.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Sep 28, 2004 16:12:23.538
!MESSAGE Missing imported package tutorial.example2.service_0.0.0.

In the tutorial, it uses the Export-Package instead of Provide-Package, so I
tried that instead, in the MANIFEST.MF for example 2:
Export-Package: tutorial.example2.service

This works OK.  

So there are a few problems here:
1. Inconsistent disabling of controls in the Runtime tab when there's an
explicit MANIFEST.MF.
2. Exporting a package generates Provide-Package instead of Export-Package (I
could not find a reference to Provide-Package in the OSGi spec).
3. No tool support for importing packages.

The current editor does not support Import/Export package, so we will keep 
this bug report open for this purpose and mark it as enhancement.

Nick, note that the current behavior of the editor is correct wrt Provide-
Package.
Provide-Package is the equivalent to what the following plugin.xml syntax:
<export name="com.example.xyz"/>, etc.  So that portion of the runtime page 
should do exactly what it did.

This is what is currently supported in PDE.  The bundle-specific Import/Export 
Package are not yet supported.

Isn't there still a problem here with the IllegalArgumentException?
I'll send you the plug-ins in question.  I don't want to attach them since they
contain external source.
All these issues have already been resolved.
